title: Simple circuits - Bulb 1 off and Bulb 2 on

content.question: A circuit is comprised of a battery, two bulbs, and two switches, as shown in the figure. What combination of switch positions, if any, would result in Bulb <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> being off and Bulb <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> being on?

choices.label: Switch <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> closed and Switch <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> open
Switch <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> open and Switch <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> closed

There is no combination of switch positions that results in Bulb <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> being off and Bulb <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> being on.

content.answer: There is no combination of switch positions that results in Bulb <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> being off and Bulb <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> being on.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
